sen.j: 真宗大谷派の大学である。
sen.e: Otani University is based on the philosophy of Otani-ha Shin Buddhism.
Otani University is based on the philosophy of Otani-ha Shin Buddhism.
Otani University is based on the philosophy of Otani-ha Shin Buddhism.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Overview
Overview
Overview

sen.j: 1665年、真宗本廟の寺内に設置された学寮を起源とする。
sen.e: Otani university was originally built as a seminary within the grounds of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in 1665.
sen.cmt: 「真宗本廟」は「東本願寺」のこと。江戸時代における「学寮」は、寺院で僧侶が止宿して修学する所（スーパー大辞林）
sen.e: Otani university was originally built as a seminary within the grounds of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in 1665.
Otani University was originally built as a seminary within the grounds of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in 1665.

sen.j: 1678年、資材の寄進を得て東本願寺の別邸渉成園内に移り、さらに1755年、規模を拡大して高倉通魚棚（五条下ル）に移転、以後「高倉学寮」と称された。
sen.e: In 1678, the seminary was relocated in the Shoseien, an annex of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, with a donation of the building materials. In 1755, it was increased in size and relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru) and renamed "Takakura Gakuryo".
sen.cmt: 定訳不明一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1678 the seminary was relocated to the Shoseien, an annex of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, with the donation of building materials; subsequently, in 1755 it was increased in size, relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru) and renamed "Takakura Gakuryo."

In 1678 the seminary was relocated to the Shoseien, an annex of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, with the donation of building materials; subsequently, in 1755 it was increased in size, relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru) and renamed "Takakura Gakuryo."

sen.j: 1868年、仏教以外の学問を研究・教育する護法場を付置。
sen.e: In 1868, Gohojo was added for the research and education of the subject fields other than Buddhist studies.
In 1868 Gohojo was added for the research and education of the subject fields other than Buddhist studies.
In 1868 Gohojo was added for research and education in fields other than Buddhist studies.

sen.j: 1896年、真宗大学と真宗高倉大学寮に分化し、1901年、真宗大学が東京巣鴨に移転・開校、学監（学長）に清沢満之が就任した。
sen.e: Takakura Gakuryo was divided into Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakura Daigakuryo in 1868, and Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo and reopened in 1901. The first president was Manshi KIYOZAWA.
sen.cmt: 真宗大学、真宗高倉大学寮の定訳不明http://web.otani.ac.jp/en/一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takakura Gakuryo was divided into Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakura Daigakuryo in 1868; and Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo, where it was reopened in 1901. The first president was Manshi Kiyozawa.

Takakura Gakuryo was divided into Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakura Daigakuryo in 1896; moreover, Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo, where it was reopened in 1901 under its first president, Manshi KIYOZAWA.
sen.cmt: 年号間違え名字大文字

sen.j: 1911年、再び真宗高倉大学寮と統合され真宗大谷大学と改称、高倉通魚棚の地に戻り、翌々年、現在地に移転した。
sen.e: In 1911, these two educational institutions were integrated again, being renamed Shinshu Otani University and returning to Takakura-dori Uotana, and two years later the university returned to the place where it is now.

In 1911 the two educational institutions were integrated again, being renamed Shinshu Otani University and returning to Takakura-dori Uotana; and two years later the university returned to the place where it is now.

In 1911 the two educational institutions were again integrated, being renamed Shinshu Otani University and returning to Takakura-dori Uontana; and two years later the university returned to the place where it is now located.

sen.j: 1923年、旧制大学に基づき、仏教研究及びこれと直接の関連を有する須要な学科を研究・教授する、文学部のみの単科大学として大谷大学が開設された。
sen.e: In 1923, Otani University was founded for the study of the humanities, which provides an education of Buddhist Studies and its related fields, under the former education school system.
In 1923 Otani University was founded for the study of the humanities in order to provide education in Buddhist studies and related fields, under the former education school system.
In 1923 Otani University was founded for the study of the humanities in order to provide education in Buddhist studies and related fields, under the former education school system.

sen.j: 1949年、新制大学となる。
sen.e: In 1949, it was reorganized under the new school education system.
In 1949 it was reorganized under the new school education system.
In 1949 it was reorganized under the new school education system.

sen.j: 開設時以来、文科系単科大学としての規模・内容を堅持し、建学の理念として、各専門分野の綿密な研究・教授を通じた、自己の信念確立への方向性と深い教養とを持った人物の育成を掲げる。
sen.e: Since its foundation, the university has been keeping its scale and contents as a humanities-oriented university. Its founding philosophy is to nurture those who firmly establish themselves in faith and has deep knowledge.

Since its foundation, the university has been keeping its scale and contents as a humanities-oriented university whose founding philosophy is to nurture those who firmly establish themselves in faith and have deep knowledge.

Since its foundation, the university has maintained its scale and contents as a humanities-oriented university whose founding philosophy is to nurture those who firmly establish themselves in faith and have deep knowledge, doing so through in-depth research and the teaching of specialized subjects.
sen.cmt: 「各専門分野の綿密な研究・教授を通じた」訳抜け

sen.j: 鈴木大拙をはじめ著名な学者が教授として在任した。
sen.e: Prominent scholars such as Daisetsu SUZUKI taught at the university as professors.
Prominent scholars such as Daisetsu Suzuki taught as professors at the University.
Prominent scholars such as Daisetsu SUZUKI taught as professors at the University.

sen.j: また、曽我量深、金子大栄、山口益等の、近現代を代表する仏教思想家・仏教学者を輩出している。
sen.e: The university has produced many Buddhist philosophers and scholars who represent modern and postmodern Japan as follows: Ryojin SOGA, Daiei KANEKO, and Susumu YAMAGUCHI.
The university has produced many Buddhist philosophers and scholars who represent modern and postmodern Japan, as follows: Ryojin Soga, Daiei Kaneko and Susumu Yamaguchi.
The University has produced many Buddhist philosophers and scholars who represent modern and postmodern Japan, including Ryojin SOGA, Daiei KANEKO and Susumu YAMAGUCHI.

sen.j: 卒業生は、専門分野における特性を反映し、僧侶・教員・図書館司書・博物館学芸員・社会福祉・出版等々、幅広い分野において活躍している。
sen.e: With their specialized knowledge, graduates are taking lively parts in wide range of working fields as monks, teachers, librarians, curators, social welfare workers, editors and so on.
sen.cmt: 「社会福祉・出版」は前述の項目が人を表しているので、それぞれ「社会福祉士」、「編集者」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: With their specialized knowledge, graduates are activity involved in diverse fields of endeavor as monks, teachers, librarians, curators, social welfare workers, editors and so on.
With their specialized knowledge, graduates are activity involved in diverse fields of endeavor as monks, teachers, librarians, curators, social welfare workers, editors and so on.

sen.j: 付置の図書館は、蔵書数74万冊。
sen.e: University library holds 740000 books.
The University's library holds 740,000 books.
The University's library holds 740,000 books.

sen.j: 永年にわたり蓄積された内外の貴重典籍の公開、各専門分野の学術書・重要図書の網羅的な収集・公開が行なわれており、文科系単科大学としては質量ともに国内随一を誇る。
sen.e: The library is in both quantity and quality one of the foremost libraries for the study of the humanities in Japan, exhibiting important books which have been collected for years. The library is still collecting academic books and important books in various subject fields, and exhibits them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The library is in both quantity and quality one of the foremost libraries for the study of the humanities in Japan, exhibiting important books that have been collected over many years. The library continues to collect academic books and important books in various subject fields, and exhibits them. GRAM, PUNCT

The library is, in terms of both quantity and quality, one of the leading facilities for the study of the humanities in Japan, exhibiting important domestic and foreign books that have been collected over many years; today it continues to collect and exhibit academic books and important works in various subject fields.

sen.j: 博物館には、12,000点余りの文化財が収蔵され、随時展観されている。
sen.e: University Museum holds 12,000 cultural properties and exhibits them constantly as well as 8 important cultural properties such as "Sango shiki chu shu" (written by Kukai, annotated "Sango shiki", "Shunki" (diary of FUJIWARA no Sukefusa, a noble in Heian period), "Senchakuhongan nenbutsu shu " (written by Honen), and "Yuasa Kagemoto Kishinjo" (with autograph of Myoe).

The University Museum holds 12,000 cultural properties, which are continuously exhibited, as well as eight important cultural properties including "Sango shiki chu shu" (written by Kukai, annotated "Sango shiki"; "Shunki" (diary of Fujiwara no Sukefusa, a noble of the Heian period); "Senchakuhongan nenbutsu shu " (written by Honen); and "Yuasa Kagemoto Kishinjo" (with the autograph of Myoe).
The University Museum holds 12,000 cultural artifacts which are continuously exhibited.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処The structure of the edited sentence seems OK but I have added explanations for the romaji terms used where necessary. Please check whether these explanations are correct. I'm afraid I'm not quite sure what is meant by "『三教指帰』の古注釈" so I have left the existing translation as is.

sen.j: 収蔵品には、『三教指帰注集』(空海著『三教指帰』の古注釈)、『春記』(平安時代の貴族藤原資房の日記)、『選択本願念仏集』(法然著)、「湯浅景基寄進状」(明恵の自筆署名あり)などの国の重要文化財8点が含まれている。
sen.e: Included in the collection are eight important cultural artifacts such as "Sango shiki chu shu" (written by Kukai, annotated "Sango shiki"); "Shunki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Sukefusa, a noble of the Heian period); "Senchakuhongan nenbutsu shu" (a collection of Buddhist invocations written by Honen); and "Yuasa Kagemoto Kishinjo" (a letter signed by Myoe, a Japanese Buddhist monk).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: Chronology
Chronology

sen.j: 1665年 学寮、東本願寺の寺内に創設
sen.e: 1665: A seminary was established in the grounds of the Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
1665: A seminary was established on the grounds of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
1665: A seminary was established on the grounds of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1678年 学寮、東本願寺の別邸渉成園内に移転
sen.e: 1678: The seminary was relocated in the Shoseien, an annex to Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
1678: The seminary was relocated to Shoseien, an annex to Higashi Hongan-ji
1678: The seminary was relocated to Shoseien, an annex of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1755年 学寮、高倉通魚棚（五条下ル）に移転。
sen.e: 1755: The seminary was relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru).
1755: The seminary was relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru).
1755: The seminary was relocated to Takakura-dori Uontana (Gojo kudaru).

sen.j: 以後、「高倉学寮」と称される
sen.e: Thereafter it was called "Takakura Gakuryo."
Thereafter it was called "Takakura Gakuryo."
Thereafter it was called "Takakura Gakuryo."

sen.j: 1868年 学寮に護法場を付置
sen.e: 1868: Gohojo was added to the seminary.
1868: Gohojo was added to the seminary.
1868: Gohojo was added to the seminary.

sen.j: 1896年 真宗大学と真宗高倉大学寮とに分化
sen.e: 1896: The seminary was divided into Sinshu University and Shinshu Takakuradaigakuryo.
1896: The seminary was divided into Sinshu University and Shinshu Takakuradaigakuryo.
1896: The seminary was divided into Sinshu University and Shinshu Takakura Daigakuryo.

sen.j: 1897年 真宗大学、初代学監に占部観順が就任
sen.e: 1897: Kanjun URABE became the first dean of Shinshu Daigaku.
1897: Kanjun Urabe became the first dean of Shinshu Daigaku.
1897: Kanjun URABE became the first dean of Shinshu Daigaku.

sen.j: 1899年 真宗大学、私立学校令により認可。
sen.e: 1899: Shinshu University was approved under the private school ordinance.
1899: Shinshu University was approved under the Private School Ordinance.
1899: Shinshu University was approved under the Private School Ordinance.

sen.j: 関根仁応主幹が大学代表者として認可
sen.e: Jino SEKINE was accepted as representative of the university.
Jino Sekine was accepted as the representative of the university.
Jino SEKINE was accepted as the representative of the University.

sen.j: 1901年 真宗大学、東京巣鴨に移転開校。
sen.e: 1901: Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo.
1901: Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo.
1901: Shinshu University was relocated to Sugamo, Tokyo.

sen.j: 学監（大学代表者）に清沢満之就任 1)
sen.e: Manshi KIYOZAWA became the first president of the university.
Manshi Kiyozawa became the University's first president.
Manshi KIYOZAWA became the University's first president.

sen.j: 1904年 真宗大学、専門学校令により認可
sen.e: 1904: Shinshu University was approved under the professional school ordinance.
1904: Shinshu University was approved under the Professional School Ordinance.
1904: Shinshu University was approved under the Professional School Ordinance.

sen.j: 1911年 真宗大学、真宗高倉大学寮と統合され、真宗大谷大学と改称。
sen.e: 1911: Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakuradaigakuryo were integrated and renamed Shinshu Otani University.
1911: Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakuradaigakuryo were integrated and renamed as Shinshu Otani University.
1911: Shinshu University and Shinshu Takakura Daigakuryo were integrated and renamed as Shinshu Otani University.

sen.j: 高倉通魚棚の地に戻る
sen.e: The university returned to Takakura-dori Uotana.
The University returned to Takakura-dori Uotana.
The University returned to Takakura-dori Uontana.

sen.j: 1913年 現在地に移転
sen.e: 1913: The university was relocated to the present site.
1913: The University was relocated to its present site.
1913: The University was relocated to its present site.

sen.j: 1923年 旧制大学による大谷大学開設（文学部）、真宗大谷大学を専門部に改組
sen.e: 1923: Otani University (Faculty of Letters) was opened under the former university ordinance, and Shinshu Otani University was reorganized as a professional school.
sen.cmt: http://www.otani.ac.jp/en/letters.html 専門部の定訳不明
sen.e: 1923: Otani University (Faculty of Letters) was opened under the former University Ordinance, and Shinshu Otani University was reorganized as a professional school.
1923: Otani University (Faculty of Letters) was opened under the former University Ordinance, and Shinshu Otani University was reorganized as a professional school.

sen.j: 1949年 大谷大学（新制）開設（文学部仏教学科、哲学科、史文学科）
sen.e: 1949: Otani University (Faculty of Letters Departments of Buddhist Studies, Philosophy, and History) was approved under the new school system ordinance.
1949: Otani University (Faculty of Letters Departments of Buddhist Studies, Philosophy and History) was approved under the New School System Ordinance.
1949: Otani University (Faculty of Letters Departments of Buddhist Studies, Philosophy and History) was approved under the New School System Ordinance.

sen.j: 1950年 短期大学部開設（仏教科）
sen.e: 1950: Otani University Junior College (Department of Buddhist Studies) was founded.
1950: Otani University Junior College (Department of Buddhist Studies) was founded.
1950: Otani University Junior College (Department of Buddhist Studies) was founded.

sen.j: 1953年 大学院修士課程開設（文学研究科）
sen.e: 1953: Master's Program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.
1953: Master's Program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.
1953: Master's Program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.

sen.j: 1955年 大学院博士課程開設（文学研究科）
sen.e: 1955: Doctoral Program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.
1955: The doctoral program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.
1955: The doctoral program (Graduate School of Literature) was established.

sen.j: 1963年 短期大学部に国文科増設
sen.e: 1963: Department of Japanese Literature was added to the junior college.
1963: The Department of Japanese Literature was added to the Junior College.
1963: The Department of Japanese Literature was added to the Junior College.

sen.j: 1965年 文学部を真宗学、仏教学、哲学、社会学、史学、文学の六学科に改組
sen.e: 1965: Faculty of Letters were divided into 6 departments: Shin Buddhist Studies, Buddhist Studies, Philosophy, Sociology, History, and Literature).
1965: The Faculty of Letters was divided into six departments: Shin Buddhist Studies, Buddhist Studies, Philosophy, Sociology, History and Literature.
1965: The Faculty of Letters was divided into six departments: Shin Buddhist Studies, Buddhist Studies, Philosophy, Sociology, History and Literature.

sen.j: 1966年 短期大学部に幼児教育科増設
sen.e: 1966: Department of Early-childhood Education was added to the junior college.
1966: The Department of Early Childhood Education was added to the Junior College.
1966: The Department of Early-childhood Education was added to the Junior College.
sen.cmt: Early Childhood→Early-childhood 大学のウェブサイトの表記を優先しました。

sen.j: 1981年 真宗総合研究所開設
sen.e: 1981: The Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Research Institute was founded.
1981: The Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Research Institute was founded.
1981: The Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Research Institute was founded.

sen.j: 1992年 短期大学部国文科を文化学科に改組
sen.e: 1992: Department of Japanese Literature in junior college was reorganized as Department of Cultural Studies.
1992: The Department of Japanese Literature in the Junior College was reorganized as the Department of Cultural Studies.
1992: The Department of Japanese Literature in the Junior College was reorganized as the Department of Cultural Studies.

sen.j: 1993年 文学部に国際文化学科増設
sen.e: 1993: Department of Intercultural Studies was added to the Faculty of Letters.
1993: The Department of Intercultural Studies was added to the Faculty of Letters.
1993: The Department of Intercultural Studies was added to the Faculty of Letters.

sen.j: 2000年 文学部に人文情報学科増設
sen.e: 2000: Department of Humane Informatics was added to the Faculty of Letters.
2000: The Department of Humane Informatics was added to the Faculty of Letters.
2000: The Department of Humane Informatics was added to the Faculty of Letters.

sen.j: 2000年 東京巣鴨（上池袋）の宮仲公園に「大谷大学開学の碑」（小川一乗学長揮亳）を建立
sen.e: 2000: "A foundation monument of Otani University" with inscribed handwriting of the president Ichijo OGAWA was placed in the Miyanaka Park in Sugamo, Tokyo (Kamiikebukuro).
2000: "A foundation monument of Otani University" with inscribed with the handwriting of President Ichijo Ogawa was placed in Miyanaka Park, located in Sugamo, Tokyo (Kamiikebukuro).
2000: "A foundation monument of Otani University" inscribed with the handwriting of President Ichijo OGAWA was placed in Miyanaka Park, located in Sugamo, Tokyo (Kamiikebukuro).

sen.j: 2001年 真宗総合学術センター響流館竣工
sen.e: 2001: The Korukan (Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Academic Center) was completed.
2001: The Korukan (Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Academic Center) was completed.
2001: The Korukan (Shin Buddhist Comprehensive Academic Center) was completed.

sen.j: 2003年 博物館開館
sen.e: 2003: University Museum was established.
2003: University Museum was established.
2003: University Museum was established.

sen.j: 1)大谷大学は真宗大学東京移転を「大学近代化」とし、清沢満之を「初代学長」とする。
sen.e: 1) Otani University considers that relocation of Shinshu University was "modernization of the university", therefore Manshi KIYOZAWA was seen as "the first president".
1) Otani University considers that the relocation of Shinshu University heralded the "modernization of the university"; therefore, Manshi Kiyozawa was seen as "the first president."
